result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Antonio Vargas Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All amounts due are to be paid at a rate of $50 per month commencing June 1, 2022 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full. There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Time served sentence. With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. 

Defendant shall contact the Washington County Jail within 3 days for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

defendant.name: Vargas Hernandez, Jose Antonio

records.addlTxt: Washington County Sheriff's Office Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Washington County Sheriff's Office Jail Disposition of Prisoners

Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jose Antonio Vargas Hernandez in court. Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court for Jose Antonio Vargas Hernandez. Spanish interpreter, Sarah St. John also appears in person. Agreement reached. Def pleads guilty; is convicted and sentenced.

Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jose Antonio Vargas Hernandez appeared by video from Washington Co Jail, in custody. Interpreter Laura Salcido Blancas by video. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Def advises he will be represented by SPD. Def states he did not receive notice of prior court date. Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jose Antonio Vargas Hernandez not in court. Warrant and bail forf ordered.
Initial appearance on February 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
